Class SignatureIdentifier

java.lang.Object
SignatureIdentifier
public class SignatureIdentifier extends Object
A utility class to analyze a dice roll and determine the possible moves that can be made. It confirms if a proposed move is valid. It to assists with highlighting legal moves in the GUI and to determine the legality of moves for the GameManager.

  • Method Details

    • analyzeRoll

      public static short analyzeRoll(int diceMask)
      Loops through all possible DiceSignatures and determines if the dice roll matches the signature. If it does, the signature is added to the possible moves.
      Parameters:
      diceMask -
      Returns:
      16 bits describing the matching signatures.

    • matchesSignature

      public static boolean matchesSignature(DiceSignature signature, int diceMask)
      Determines if the dice roll matches the signature. Using the switch statement has significantly streamlined the code and made it much easier to read and maintain.
      Parameters:
      signature -
      diceMask -
      Returns:
      If the dice roll matches the signature.

    • decodeMoves

      public static List<DiceSignature> decodeMoves(short encodedMoves)
      Decodes the encoded moves and returns a list of DiceSignatures. Since we are using a bitset to handle the encoded moves, we needed some way to present them in a more human-readable format. It helps keep the code clean and easy to understand.
      Parameters:
      encodedMoves -
      Returns:
      List
